formElement.label: Service Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the service in CloudBees Flow that encapsulates the service to be deployed on a stand-alone Docker host or a Docker Swarm cluster.

formElement.label: Project Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the project that the service belongs to. In case of an application-level service it also owns the application.

formElement.label: Application Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the application that the service belongs to. Not applicable for a top-level service.

formElement.label: Application Revision ID:
formElement.documentation: Revision Id of the application version that the service belongs to.

formElement.label: Cluster Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the cluster in CloudBees Flow that encapsulates the stand-alone Docker host or a Docker Swarm cluster on which the service is to be deployed.

formElement.label: Cluster Or Environment Project Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the project that the cluster belongs to if it is a top-level project cluster. Or the name of the project that the environment belongs to if it is an environment-scoped cluster.

formElement.label: Environment Name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the environment that the cluster belongs to. Not applicable for a top-level project cluster.

formElement.label: Service Name Override:
formElement.documentation: Name to use for the service being deployed instead of the name of the service in CloudBees Flow.

formElement.label: Networks:
formElement.documentation: Comma separated (CSV) list of networks to create for application.

formElement.label: Subnets:
formElement.documentation: Comma separated (CSV) list of subnets for networks mentioned in 'Networks' field. Multiple subnets for same network must be separated by '|' (pipe).

formElement.label: Gateways:
formElement.documentation: Comma separated (CSV) list of gateways for networks mentioned in 'Networks' field. Multiple gateways for same network must be separated by '|' (pipe).
